Theoretical & Computational Chemistry at the University of Pittsburgh

The University of Pittsburgh has one of the largest groups of researchers engaged in Theoretical & Computational Chemistry research of any U. S. academic institution.

Graduate Programs in Theoretical and Computational Chemistry

Oct 10, 2015

Students interested in theoretical and/or computational chemistry can either directly apply to a faculty member’s home department - such as the Graduate Program in Chemistry, or apply to the newly created Computational Modeling & Simulation PhD program. The CMSP has been especially created to offer students the opportunity to perform research in any of the computational member groups across campus, combined with an interdisciplinary education in scientific computing and modeling.
